# uv can't install packages with very long version numbers

---

_Issue opened by @nkitsaini on 2025-02-26 04:45_

### Summary
NOTE: This has not been fixed yet, see comment below.

`uv` can't parse versions with long digits as it expects each segment to fit in a u64. 

This does _not_ come from a real use-case and should be pretty rare, so the issue should be very low priority. I found this while working on https://github.com/astral-sh/uv/pull/11738 and it was still not easy to find a package that worked with pip but didn't with uv.

I doubt anyone will run into this, from a quick look at [pypi-data](https://github.com/pypi-data/pypi-json-data) there are very few packages with such versioning. I am creating the issue mostly to make sure it is a conscious decision to not support these versions.



**pip:**
```
.venv ❯ pip install lyricsprocessor==0.1.40404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040
Collecting lyricsprocessor==0.1.40404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040
  Downloading lyricsprocessor-0.1.40404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040.tar.gz (6.4 kB)
```
**uv:**
```
.venv ❯ uv pip install lyricsprocessor==0.1.4040404040404
0404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040
error: Failed to parse: `lyricsprocessor==0.1.40404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040`
  Caused by: expected number less than or equal to 18446744073709551615, but number found in "40404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040404040" exceeds it
```

<details>

_Comment by @nkitsaini on 2025-02-26 05:04_

Hm, the more I think about it, I don't think it is worth anyone's time to look at this. It is going to be very rare, if any real use-case gets blocked by this, we can reopen.


EDIT: Did not want to mark this as completed but can't update it now.
